segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit the identifying number.
DTM, A segment to provide the date and time of the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify a reference applying to the whole message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify a reference, e.g. reference to previous message.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to indicate the details of the means of transport, with related locations, arrival dates and times, measurement, etc.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to identify the means of transport (e.g. by Lloyd's Register number of a vessel, or by the license plate number of a truck) and the type of the means of transport.
DTM, A segment to indicate the estimated date and time of arrival, and the date and time of departure.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location relating to the means of transport, such as: - place or port of departure - next place or port of call.
RFF, A segment to specify a reference as an additional identification of the means of transport, e.g. radio call sign of a vessel.
MEA, A segment to specify a measurement of the means of transport, e.g. gross tonnage (of a vessel).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify a party which could give further information on the conveyance of the means of transport.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party's name, address and function from which further information can be obtained (e.g. port authority, harbour master).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segment to indicate a contact within the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within the party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of the contact to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods. The group is meant to be a recapitulation across all consignments on board of the means of transport, for dangerous goods that adhere to a certain combination of IMO code (i.e. International Maritime Organisation), IMO page number, UNDG number (i.e. United Nations Dangerous Goods number) and flashpoint.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the selection criteria for which a recapitulation is given, according to the appropriate regulation (e.g. IMO).
FTX, A segment to specify the dangerous goods technical name related to the detailed dangerous goods classification as given in the DGS segment, and to provide additional dangerous goods information.
MEA, A segment to specify the gross weight of the recapitulation for the detailed dangerous goods classification as given in the DGS segment.
LOC, A segment to specify the location on the means of transport where the dangerous goods are stowed, e.g. stowage cell on a container vessel.
SGP, A segment to identify the equipment (e.g. container number) in which the dangerous goods are placed.
